entities: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime
summary:
Welcomes progress in implementing the Afghanistan National Development Strategy (ANDS), stresses the need for continued leadership, and encourages increased pledges, including financial assistance.

 Expresses concern over opium cultivation, production, and trafficking, and calls on the Afghan Government to implement the National Drug Control Strategy with international assistance.

 Welcomes the outcome of the Second Ministerial Conference on Drug Trafficking Routes from Afghanistan and calls for strengthened international cooperation to counter the threat posed by illicit production and trafficking.

 Calls on all parties to cooperate with UNAMA in promoting security and freedom of movement.

 Calls on the Afghan Government and international community to address the threat posed by the Taliban, Al-Qaida, and other extremist groups.

 Welcomes efforts to foster trust and cooperation between Afghanistan and its regional partners.

 Recognizes the importance of voluntary return and sustainable reintegration of Afghan refugees.

 Requests the Secretary-General to report to the Council every six months on developments in Afghanistan.

 Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
